entries.title: IDEA
points: Collaborated across the IDEA team to update various features of their websiste
Created and open-sourced a Slack bot to increase engagement in weekly reports

entries.title: Scout
points: Led a web-based design project for Scout, Northeastern’s student-led design studio
Managed a team of three designers to create various design assets for our client, SmartAble’s, product
Facilitated and mediated client interactions through various reports, updates, and meetings with established milestones to help guide and show progress

entries.title: PayPal
points: Implemented new features and fixed bugs in PayPal’s new merchant iOS app using Swift, Objective-C, and JavaScript with the support of many open-source and proprietary libraries
Participated in PayPal’s new app launch process by working with other teams to ensure the app met certain benchmarks in areas such as user experience, accessibility, and security

entries.title: Kyruus
points: Implemented and updated various core product features through the development of the UI and the corresponding backend API using various web-based technologies.
Planned, wrote, and helped execute various data migration scripts on several primary databases with hundreds of thousands of records.
Deployed applications to development and production environments while gaining experience debugging deployments and modifying the deployer scripts or the human deployment process.
Learned about start-ups and early-stage companies' growth through witnessing the substantial transformation of Kyruus over my co-op as the company gained funding and added customers.

entries.title: Genius Switch Studio
points: Collaborated with the development and design teams through meetings, Git, and various technologies to build websites using Drupal, Bootstrap, and several open-source JavaScript, CSS, and PHP libraries.
Trained clients to use their newly created systems and resolved any discrepancies between their requirements and the product.

entries.title: ListLocal
points: Collaborated with two graduate students to form an early-stage startup based out of the Harvard Innovation Lab.
Designed and developed an iOS application’s architecture, UI, and processes using Swift and a Parse backend.

entries.title: Mad Munchy Snake
points: Created my first iOS app while in high school
Utilized open-source libraries like Cocos2d to rapidly develop the game
Connected the app with Google's ad platform in an attempt to monetize it

entries.title: TigerPaw Software
points: Created the interface for Tigerpaw Software's forum to match their existing website.
Built a feature request system to allow users to mark feature requests as desirable.
Altered and added about 30 small features.

entries.title: Watchily
points: Designed the interface for Watchily's redesign.
Utilized Bootstrap to rapidly create a single-page interface with many different components.

entries.title: HysterSisters
points: Created the forum interface from supplied PSDs.
Created the blog interface based off design elements included in the PSDs.
Completed various maintenance work on HysterSister's forum.

entries.title: Inside Lacrosse
points: Developed a social-media extension for Inside Lacrosse's forum.
Added various social features like photo and equipment galleries.
Worked with a small team to ensure that the production launch went smoothly.

entries.title: MVP Graphics Supply
points: First complete website done for a client (launched in 2008).
Design the interface, logo, and various branding materials.
Developed an entire e-commerce content system based on open-source PHP frameworks.
